aiAnalysis.summary: AFJ Limited's staging environment demonstrates adequate authentication controls with all admin endpoints properly protected (403 responses), and SSL/TLS is correctly implemented. However, the security posture is significantly weakened by widespread absence of critical security headers across multiple pages. Four pages are missing essential headers like X-Content-Type-Options and X-Frame-Options, which are fundamental defenses against MIME-type sniffing and clickjacking attacks. Additionally, recommended security headers (HSTS, CSP, Referrer-Policy, Permissions-Policy) are almost entirely absent, leaving the application vulnerable to various client-side attacks.
recommendations: Immediately implement X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff on all pages to prevent MIME-type sniffing attacks
Add X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN (or DENY) to all pages to prevent clickjacking; note that /admin already has this correctly configured
Configure Strict-Transport-Security header with appropriate max-age (recommend 31536000) to enforce HTTPS across all pages
Implement Content-Security-Policy header with restrictive directives appropriate to your application architecture to mitigate XSS and injection attacks
Add Referrer-Policy header (recommend 'strict-origin-when-cross-origin') to control referrer information leakage
Enable Permissions-Policy header to restrict browser features and APIs that could be exploited
Apply these headers consistently across all pages, especially sensitive areas like /admin and /quote
Implement header security as part of your web server configuration (nginx/Apache) rather than application-level for consistency
